Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brian g
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful experience it was to stay here..Our Host Ali was fantastic..so helpful with everything..from directions , loaning umbrellas, calling transports..you name it ..And the breakfast was so plentiful we could sight see all day and not be hungry until dinner..Charming rooms ..great location and a good price..

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HungryMongoose
Reviews.Content: Charming boutique hotel. Very conveniently and centrally located at the southern end of the main shopping street (Istiklal Caddesi) with easy access to Sultanahmet via a short funicular train ride, or walk, to the quay at Karakoy where you can catch the tram. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great views from the terrace where you have breakfast in the morning - also open for guests to relax in and have a drink in the evening. Breakfast, which is buffet style, is very good and substantial. Some rooms a little small, but clean and comfortable and absolutely fine for our needs. At the time of our stay (summer 2011) they were renovating the first two floors (the upper floors in which we stayed were already renovated) and the reception lounge - should have finished by now and will be very nice I'm sure. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but who wants to eat in a hotel when there are so many wonderful restaurants all over Istanbul serving some of the best food we have tasted? If you want a lot of space and a swimming pool, this hotel isn't for you, but if you want a comfortable, friendly, clean, convenient base for exploring both the modern and historical aspects of the city, the Galata Antique is perfect. We recommend it wholeheartedly and look forward ourselves to going back. (Access to the hotel is via stairs so probably difficult for wheel chair users).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed wt the service”
Reviews.Author: winnie8281s
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start! Lets start with the pick up transport which never turned up, I even sent an email to remind them to pick us up from the airport after reading several reviews regarding the no show of the driver. We took a cab from the airport to the hotel. Once we reached the hotel, we told the front desk staff about the disappointment and she ignored us. We managed to have an earlier check in @ 8am. There wasn't a porter to help with your bags. (FYI: there are a few steps to access the main entrance of the hotel and a few more steps to access the lift, I hope your partner is strong to carry your bag for you, if not all the best to you). We were given a room number 401 which was very noisy in the morning as breakfast was served at 5th floor, just above our room. On top of that, the lift only stop at 4th floor, all the guests have to walked up to 5th floor. We went for the breakfast, they only served cheese, dried fruits, breads and cold cut. During check out, I told her in the email stated if I pay cash, the hotel will give us 5% discount and she said no. Then I saw a note on the folder and I pointed to her, she unhappily give us the discount. The room rate per night for superior room is 100 Euro which are too expensive. I will NOT recommend anyone to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good experience”
Reviews.Author: Alena A
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel. It is located in new part of Istanbul, near biggest shopping road Istical Caddesi. Unfortunately this is all positive that I can write about it. We lived in the room on the top floor near breakfast area. Room was small, no space to put our belongings. Drainage in the bathroom was terribly smelling and the smell was moving also to the room. Breakfast were without fruits, vegetable or juice - just several pieces of the cheese, eggs omelet, butter and bread. For lemon to the tea we needed to wait until the staff brings it from downstairs. Reception staff was kind, but they were not able to support us with information. The hotel quality was not equal with the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pehota
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay there. Great location, unbelievable view from the terrace. Friendly and helpful staff. The hotel was undergoing renovation during our stay and it looked it was going to be even greater. Definitely will stay there again on our next trip to Istanbul. Some minor glitches (like not being able to get in our room because of key card problems, loose toilet seat) held me back from giving a full 5 out of 5, but those were fixed in a timely manner. Just go ahead and give it a try. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “One of these small, but well placed hotels”
Reviews.Author: Gllobe-trotter
Reviews.Content: A small hotel in a five-story building, with only a few rooms on each level. It perfectly placed at the beginning of Istiklal Caddesi, the main street of Beyoglu, between the entrance to Sishane Metro station and the nostalgic tramway line. The surrounding is full of small stores, restaurants and (obviously) tourists. In the evenings it is quite noisy. The rooms are very small, but clean and sufficiently equipped. There was a renovation recently. The bathroom is a little bit too small and less carefully maintained. The staff is friendly, but not very well trained and not necessarily speaking English. A big advantage of this hotel is the bar at the roof of the building. The hotel is placed on a hillside, which results with a beautiful view on the roofs of the other buildings, including Galata Tower, the Golden Horn bay and it's other side with the historical buildings on the horizon. The bar is open in the evenings and in the mornings (the breakfasts don't offer a lot of choice through).

Reviews.Title: “STINKS....how's that.”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonianGuy
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 days here. I am not usually one to complain and I have never written a negative review before. Let me do Pros first -- because that is easy: Location. Why this place stinks: They say free transfer from the airport -- but they never picked me up or responded to my emails. So I had to pay 40 Lira for a taxi. First night we had no air condition and so we had to keep our windows open and listen to the VERY loud seagulls all night. The room was super hot too. They moved us to another room, and there was no where to attach the shower head to the wall. So you had to hold it in the shower the whole time, which resulted in me soaking the entire bathroom. They did laundry for me, but it didn't come back dry! In general, the people that work there are nice but not able to help you with anything. Avoid this place. Trust me. I couldn't wait to get home and call them out on their BS.

Reviews.Title: “Genius”
Reviews.Author: JONG10
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a colleague at the Galata Antique Hotel on Thursday the 14th April. When we arrived our travel agent had neglected to send our booking through to the hotel. They could not have been more welcoming and helpful, offering us a a drink while sorting out the error. The manager Serkan was very kind, and when the mix up had been sorted out gave us an upgrade to a larger room which had spectacular views of the city. The room itself was lovely with a free standing bath and flat screen TV and a brief walk put us right in the heart of Beyoglu. When we returned to the hotel later that evening, they re-opened the bar for us without a fuss. We had an excellent breakfast the next morning and toddled off to our meeting in good spirits. Our only regret being that we hadn't booked to stay longer as the hospitality and room had been so enjoyable. The hotel is listed as a three star but if you can get one of the rooms on the top floor it is definitely a four star experience. This coupled with the sort of character that most hotels can only dream of makes it far superior to staying in a drab corporate multi chain hotel. I'd thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “really nice and lovely place, charming”
Reviews.Author: docfromparis
Reviews.Content: perfect situation, perfect and lovely staff... we had great vacations, thanks to the hotel. the staff allways tried to make things easy, to helped us to enjoye the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with friendly staff and PERFECT location”
Reviews.Author: iestokes
Reviews.Content: I just arrived back home after a 6 night stay at the Galata Antique hotel. The hotel is in an absolutely perfect location, right around the corner from the Tunel Sq. funicular stop and also the modern metro. It is very easy to get into the Sultanahmet/Old City area via public transport. We actually found ourselves primarily walking to the old city by way of the Galata Bridge which made for an interesting way to explore the neighborhood. It is about a 30 minute (very scenic) walk to the Blue Mosque/Aya Sofya/etc. The reason why we stayed in this area as opposed to Sultanahmet is because we were looking for a good place with lots of nightlife and we sure picked the right spot. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from Istiklal St. with innumerable bars, restaurants and shops. This is definitely a less touristy area than the old city and seemed to be much more lively at night with plenty of live music and comfortable places to have some drinks and meet the friendly locals. So, aside from the location, the actual hotel was a very pleasant place to stay. Our room was a bit small but it was very clean and cozy. It definitely made a good home base for sleeping and taking a break after a long day of sightseeing, which is exactly what we wanted. The staff was very nice and accommodating and made us feel at home from the moment we arrived. There is a free breakfast every morning on the rooftop with a great view; the breakfast itself is okay, nothing spectacular but plenty of coffee, tea, fruits, jams, bread and usually sausage or eggs. I only have one minor complaint about our stay at the Galata Antique. The hotel has free wireless access however the reception is quite bad. We had no access from our room and had to use wireless from the lobby, where the reception was also poor. This was definitely not a big deal but it was a minor annoyance. All in all, this is a great little place with friendly staff, clean rooms and a wonderful location. I would strongly recommend considering this hotel if you are planning on staying in Istanbul. Oh, and one more quick tip: The main entrance to the hotel is located on a side staircase off the main road. It's not that difficult to find but just an FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor service”
Reviews.Author: michelangela064
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed at the hotel for almost 9 days. At my arrival at the Ataturk International airport was nobody there from the hotel to collect us, when I did the reservation almost one month before of my arrival. I got the room that I reserved after almost 6 hours after my arrival in Istanbul. The hotel is situated in good location near to shopping area and the transport. The rooms are small but clean. Some details like bulbs in the bathroom was not working, the laundry takes long before getting back your clothes and the staff were not very cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Elbsandra
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Galata Hotel and we had a great time. The hotel is around 120yrs. old and still has the charme of an old villa from back then. The rooms are small but very nicely furnished. And the view from our room (4th floor) and terrace are amazing. You can see the Topkapi Palace, Gatata Tower, Bosporus, Mosques and a lot more. The hotel is situated in a small street just off the main shopping and nightlife area of Istanbul. Perfect location! You can sleep in quite but you are in the middle of everything in just 1min walk. Prices are moderate - compared what other hotels charge. And they give 5% discount if you pay in cash. Breakfast is not amazing - but tasty. Fresh vegetables, fruit salad, cheese, yoghurt, bÃ¶rek and more. Every day the same though - so if you stay longer then a week you might wish for some changes. The staff is friendliy and helpful - most of them speak poor English. This hotel is definitly a recommendation. If we should go back to Istanbul we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Renovated French-Style Boutique Hotel with Rooftop Breakfast in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: DaynaThomas
Reviews.Content: Galata Antika Otel is ideally located in the hip Beyoglu/Taksim area. The hotel is currently under top-down renovation, and luckily enough we got one of the new rooms. The room was like a small Parisian suite, with high ceilings and beautiful detailing. The marble bath was magnificent but a little wonky, as it seemed the fixtures were not yet fully installed and the temperature in the shower was 'temperamental'. The room was designer decorated, the air-conditioning was strong, and the breakfast was served on the rooftop with a view of the city and Bosphorous. The location was ideal: one block from the metro and the main street leading to Taksim square. We preferred the young local scene, rather than the tourist experience in Sultanemeht. A lovely boutique hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business”
Reviews.Author: tobias2trip
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, had no hot water and did not want to fix. Breakfast was not much

Reviews.Title: “Antique is the word. Not a three stars hotel.”
Reviews.Author: linda_travel_review
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and expensive. Booked for 4 nights which included free pick up at the international airport but checked out the following morning. Got charged 50 lira for that pick up since I stayed only one night. Hotel needs updating very badly everywhere. Hallways are dark. My room was very small, cramped and smelled of cigarettes. The bathroom was so tiny I cannot turn around. No amenities. Walls are thin. You can hear conversations from the other rooms at 2 in the morning. Toilets from the upper floors were flushing every three or four minutes all night. The noise outside was as bad. I checked their hotel rates with Expedia, Travelocity and Vaneer befor I left for Istanbul and found out the hotel website rate was very high at 110 euro/night for a standard room/non-smoking. Emailed hotel and complained. They reduced the rate at 78 euro. Positive part is the Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is standard with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: As regular visitors to Istanbul we normally stay in the Sultanahmet district, but decided this time to try out the Galata area. Galata Antique Hotel was an obvious choice, with its close proximity to the Galata Tower and we weren't disappointed, particularly in view of the very reasonable price we paid for a delux twin room for three nights. The actual room was spotlessly clean, with a very elegant marble bathroom which still provided all the essentials. The hotel also has a period charm, having been built as a private home in the 1880s, so it has its occasional quirks and oddities. One floor was being modernised during our stay, but this didn't really affect our visit - there was no noise or dust evident. The top floor breakfast room offers very pleasant views and the buffet breakfast was pretty decent too. The staff were very helpful and the front desk guys were especially willing to provide local information, maps and advice. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning to base yourself in Galata and want a reasonably priced, spotlessly clean place to stay. It is close to some of the best (ie less tourist orientated) shopping and a short hop by tram, or on foot, to Taxim Square. Lots of small and friendly restaurants in the area and a little less crowded than the main tourist traps over in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, medium service”
Reviews.Author: asanse
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect to explore Istanbul. It's close to Istiklal with which is a very good area for the nightlife. The service is only medium. I had booked a double bedroom whilst what I found was a twin beds. I asked the room that I had booked but I was told that there were no other rooms. What's the point of booking a double bedroom on their website then? All they could do was to transform my twin beds in a double bed for the second night. Another point is that the WiFi network is too weak. It was very hard to connect from the room, so I wouldn't suggest it for business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but a bit old”
Reviews.Author: Noskis12
Reviews.Content: Galata Antique Hotel will offer you a splendid view from its highest floor (where you will have breakfast). It has a superb location - the best possible in Istanbul, very close to everything. There is a metro station within 1 min walking distance from the hotel - if you want to go shopping by metro. It's a very cute and nice hotel for a budget traveller: a bit old, but with it's own charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel : good price and service”
Reviews.Author: Ault
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, close to the Galata tower. The service is very very nice, and warmful. The rooms are small but very comfy and elegant. The breakfast is nice and generous. You take it on a roof top terrace, looking at all the bay, it is very beautiful. The only thing is that there is some noise on friday and saturday evening as it is very close to Beyoglu's party area. Yet, it wasn't really a problem and it is linked to the good location of the hotel. The most striking thing about the hotel is how nice the employees are.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: lovesgoodfood
Reviews.Content: As most reviewers have noted, this hotel is in a fantastic location. We stayed one night, then returned for a five-night stay a couple of weeks later. It was extremely easy to get around the whole city from here. Also, the area surrounding it has 24-hr restaurant and clubs. The staff is friendly, helpful and welcoming. Also, having breakfast on the roof everyday was such a great way to start each day. The views are wonderful. All that said, it was very loud. The revelers and cabs are loud which is to be expected, but the construction and destruction noise was a bit much. One night the building next door had workers starting to do construction projects at 1AM .... another night a building nearby was being demolished - again in the middle of the night - and it sounded like a pile-driver was being used. Even the staff made comments after that night! I would recommend this hotel because of its location. The amenities are not A-1 and the rooms might be considered small-ish if you've never been to a European style boutique hotel. We stayed in two different rooms - one was quite comfortable and the other was a little tighter, but both were clean. But, IMHO, you are in Istanbul to see the sights, not to hang out in a hotel. The ease of getting to any historic/tourist areas is unsurpassed. You can walk or take public transportation everywhere very easily and cheaply. The little cafe just up the stairs, right next door to the hotel proved to be a wonderful place to eat. Don't miss out on the incredible Galatasaray Hamami (Turkish Bath) just 'uphill' off Istikal -- ask the staff to make an appointment and you can get a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, low standard services and facilities”
Reviews.Author: anthea_9
Reviews.Content: The only thing that is great about the hotel is its excellent location which is in the middle of almost everything as well as the building's exterior. Contrarily to what you may expect from its website description (I was expecting a small design boutique hotel with all related facilities) everything has been dissapointing. We have been assigned one of the recenly rennovated rooms but it was a complete disaster. Our room had a very strong smell of paint that it was impossible for us to sleep with a closed window. The room was so tiny that we've had difficulties on moving in it. There wasn't any closet but only a really small metallic horizontal hanger for our clothes and 3 tiny drawers. There wasn't any hairdryer (which is unadmittable for a boutique hotel) and when we asked the receptionist to provide us with one, he kept on saying "yes, don't worry, I will give you one" but never did, saying to us the last day that he couldn't find any. Our room (we were 2 in it) was provided only with 1 small bottle of bath soap and 1 of shampoo, which have NEVER (!!!) been replaced despite the fact that we've sleeped there 3 nights. We've had to ask them to provide us with new ones. Inside the shower a block of tiles was missing and you could see the building's tube. Despite the fact that the shower had a closing door it was so defective that after we were having shower a lake of water was formed in the bathroom. When we told the receptionist about the problem, he said "you have been given the new rooms, we know about the problem, and it will be fixed.." The personnel was very gentle, kind and open hearted. But I've got the feeling that they did not have the appropriate training to do this job on the way it deserves to be done. But I don't think it was their problem, I repeat, all of them were really kind and nice. I think it was the management's fault whose complete negligence on basic issues had disastrous effects on the hotel's image.In fact I was really astonished about the fact that this structure belongs to the Turkish association of boutique hotels. How on earth did they selected it and approved it? Unless you don't mind about all these important details I would definitely not reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location but room could be better and renovations meant noise and dust”
Reviews.Author: SiDeLima
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the Galata Antique Hotel. The location is just amazing; steps from the subway, tram and the street ith the most fun and amazing nightlife ever! It is in the middle of all the action, so maybe if you want a quiet place this might not be the best location. We loved having lots of cafes and restaurants at our doorstep. Other good points were a comfortable bed, clean sheets and a hot shower. The negatives: I have yet to see a smaller bathroom in a hotel. I'm pretty slender and still had a hard time navigating in it; a smelly smokey room with old, dark velevety curtains and carpet in burgundy that didn't seem to have been cleaned for a while. The other thing was that the hotel was in renovation so most of the time we couldn't use the stairs or lift; they could have told us or offered a discount to compensate for the inconvenience; the internet never worked in our room ( we had to sit in the lobby) and the promised free transfer to the airport ended up being charged.Next time I'll probably look for somewhere else close by or check if the place is better after renovations. The third floor already looked much nicer than the second, where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dqframey
Reviews.Content: We found Galata Antique Hotel to be a very good value, mostly for the primo location and exceptional, friendly service. Rooms are not huge, but plenty of space by New York standards. Bathroom was clean with small but separate shower. Breakfast provided on the roof terrace was a beautiful start to each day, overlooking Galata Tower and a view towards the old section of the city. The surrounding neighborhood is fun and lively with excellent restaurants and bars overflowing onto the narrow streets. We had no problem with street noise inside the hotel, however. "Commuting" to the more touristy Sultanahmet area was convenient, with an efficient one-stop funicular (1 TL for tokens) right next to the hotel, then either a pleasant walk across the bridge or a transfer to the modern streetcar. Staff members could not have been more friendly and helpful. Nearly all spoke English. One note: the hotel was undergoing construction on the upper floors when we were there (late August - early Sept 2009). This meant some dust, crunching through construction materials on the way to the roof terrace, and a couple of power outages. We took it in stride, but it is probably worth inquiring on the status of the renovations when you reserve a room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tikiliki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the top of Tunel station and just steps away from other mass transit and the shopping street Istiklal, in the Beyoglu neighborhood. You can get anywhere in the city easily and nightlife is walking distance. Stayed here 6 nights. It was very warm but the A/C worked well and kept the room cool at night. The breakfast buffet was okay. My only minor criticism was that although the staff truly wanted to be helpful, they were just not that well informed about the locations, hours, giving directions, etc. about things we wanted to know and do. We would just laugh and figure it out ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive hotel, great location, but musty smell in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: annabrick
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night in the hotel, while waiting for our apartment rental to open up. As others have said, the location is perfect. I do strongly recommend staying in the Beyoglu (north of the Golden Horn)part of town. There are lots of restaurants -- chic, traditional, cheap and everything in between -- and the area at night is filled with people so it feels quite safe. Public transportation is very convenient and you can easily get to the more touristy part of town during the day. The breakfast at the hotel was fine, a standard Turkish breakfast (cheese, olives, bread, jam), and the breakfast room had a wonderful view. I liked the ambience, which was more old/traditional than most of the other mid-priced hotels in the Taksim/Beyoglu neighborhood. DRAWBACKS: the rooms are tiny and it is difficult to maneuver around the bed/furniture. Most bothersome was a smell in the room: it was more than musty -- almost like a broken toilet. And it wasn't just our room. The first room we were shown had that smell but because it had twin beds we asked to be changed to a room with a double bed. Even though the second room was on another floor it also had the smell. My 3 stars are based on the price (good for the neighborhood but more expensive than comparable hotels in the Sultahnamet district), location, and charming ambience. I'm not sure I would stay here again, however.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: Kasim
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of it's location. In this respect it was excellent. Room and bathroom were small but perfectly adequate and I got a very good deal on the price anyway, so can't really grumble. There is a roof terrace which gives great views across to the old city and the Galata Tower. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean. The noise of the city starts quite early in the morning which could be considered a drawback by some. The Tunel Bistro nearby is very good for food and drink after a hard day's sightseeing, and I also recommend the Galatasaray Hamam for a good Turkish bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Desertdiva24
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a prime location! It's right next to the tram, all the stores, bars, restaurants. It's constantly busy with people. Catching the train to Sultanahmet is easy. Staff is very helpful! Mohammed is very friendly. Room is clean and sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “At least it's clean”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Who_That
Reviews.Content: Arrived just after dark, which mean it took some time to find the lights in the room. The main ceiling lamp had failed so lots of groping in the dark. I like a nice firm bed but theirs have no give at all so I have had bad hip pain since arriving. The bed was unmade the first day. Despite my best efforts with the TV I can find only one channel - in German. The shower was luke warm on arrival and cold the following morning. There is nowhere comfortable to sit and use my laptop, but at least the broadband works. Location is of course good.

Reviews.Title: “small room, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: morgendorffer
Reviews.Content: A nice small hotel with very friendly staff. The room was a bit small, but nicely furnished and clean. Location is excellent, and will be better once the underground to taksim is completed. The construction site of the tunel-station is just opposite the hotel, but we were not disturbed by any noise. Breakfast is a bit boring.

HotelInfo.Name: Galata Antique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mesrutiyet Street No:119, Istanbul 34430, Turkey
